action.action-desc: Ms. Tenney (for herself and Mr. Morelle) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture to annually publish certain data with respect to grape production, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness in Vineyard Data Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Administrator of the National Agricultural Statistics Service, shall—

paragraph.text: not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act—

subparagraph.text: conduct a survey on grape production in each State, including—

clause.text: production, utilization, and acreage by type, variety, county, and year planted; and

subparagraph.text: make publicly available on the website of the National Agricultural Statistics Service the results of such survey and the data from such survey; and

paragraph.text: not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act and annually for the 3 years thereafter, make publicly available on the website of the National Agricultural Statistics Service data from the 5 States with the highest grape production in the preceding year, as determined using data from the survey required under paragraph (1)(A).
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (a)(1) $2,500,000 for fiscal year 2026.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out subsection (a)(2) $1,500,000 for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2030.
